verb.description: Sit, lie, or fall with one's arms and legs spread out in an ungainly or awkward way.
examples: the door shot open, sending him sprawling across the pavement
she lay sprawled on the bed

noun.description: An ungainly or carelessly relaxed position in which one's arms and legs are spread out.
examples: she fell into a sort of luxurious sprawl

origin: Old English spreawlian move the limbs convulsively; related to Danish sprælle kick or splash about. The noun dates from the early 18th century.
